meanings.definition: Tiny sensory organs on the surface of an insect.
meanings.sent1: The sensilla on the ant's antenna help it detect food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the sensilla to understand how insects perceive their environment.
meanings.sent3: The sensilla on the fly's leg must be like having super-sensitive hairs!
meanings.sent4: The sensilla act as nature's tiny antennas, picking up signals from the insect's surroundings.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the sensilla look like delicate little sensors waving in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the sensilla under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Many sensilla were found on the butterfly's wings.
meanings.sent3: The sensilla in the collection were all different shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent4: The sensilla glistened in the sunlight like tiny jewels.
meanings.sent5: Each sensilla seemed to whisper secrets of the insect's world.
